# Visitor Center

The Visitor Center at Washington Crossing Historic Park is your gateway to exploring the stories, landscapes, and legacy of this historic site. Conveniently located near the main entrance of the park, the Visitor Center is the best place to begin your experience.

Inside, you’ll find:

  * Park information, maps, and friendly staff to help plan your visit
  * Engaging exhibits that bring Revolutionary history to life
  * A short orientation [film](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y6C3Glp2EO0) about Washington’s daring 1776 crossing and the Ten Crucial Days
  * Tickets for guided tours
  * A museum shop featuring gifts, books, local artisan items, and other park and Revolutionary inspired souvenirs.

The Visitor Center also includes a 238-seat auditorium used for films, concerts, lectures, and community events. A highlight of the space is a **full-size replica of Emanuel Leutze’s famous painting** , Washington Crossing the Delaware.

### **Location & Hours**

### **Address** :

1112 River Road

Washington Crossing, PA 18977

([directions](https://www.washingtoncrossingpark.org/visit/directions/) to the Visitor Center)

Free parking is available on-site.

### **Visitor Center Hours:**

Open daily, 10:00 AM – 5:00 PM

### **Museum Shop Hours:**

Open daily, 10:00 AM – 4:30 PM

### **Accessibility:**

The Visitor Center is fully ADA-accessible. All public areas are located on a single floor with accessible entrances and restrooms.

admission_text:
# Buy Tickets

### **Planning a Group Visit?**

Are you organizing a visit for a group of 15 or more? Let us help you make it a great experience at Washington Crossing Historic Park. Whether your group plans to take a guided tour or explore the park on your own, please contact us in advance. Notifying us ahead of time helps us coordinate your visit, ensure access to park amenities, and tailor the experience to your group’s needs.

To schedule your group visit, please contact us at[ Info@FriendsWCP.org](mailto:Info@FriendsWCP.org) or call 215-493-4076. We look forward to welcoming your group!

### Crossing the Delaware

**Tour days:** Daily, seasonally April – December; and weekends January – March (except holiday closures)  
**Tour times:** 10:30 AM, 11:30 AM, 1:30 PM, and 3:30 PM  
**Arrival time:** 10 to 15 minutes before the scheduled start of your tour  
**Duration:** 60 minutes  
**Address:** 1112 River Road, Washington Crossing, PA 18977  
**Cancellations and refunds:** Vouchers are valid for up to 1 year after the purchase date

This primarily outdoor tour begins in the Visitor Center with an introductory film and then explores the site on the Delaware River where General Washington and his troops crossed the Delaware River on Christmas Day in 1776. You’ll learn about the Ten Crucial Days that turned the tide of the Revolutionary War. Discover how Washington’s troops made it across the river, and what the crossing – and its aftermath – was like for the Continental Army...
